intro: Pimpinella praeventa, commonly known as the Italian茴香, is a flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that appear in umbrella-like clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. The seeds of Pimpinella praeventa are also used as a spice in some cuisines.
